tool.name: Bigwig Files to VEuPathDB
tool.description: Export one or more bigwig files to VEuPathDB where they can be viewed as tracks in the Genome Browser.

param.name: dataset_name
param.label: My Data Set name:
param.help: The export will create a new My Data Set in a VEuPathDB site. Specify the name for the new My Data Set.

validator.message: Only letters, numbers, spaces and dashes are allowed in the name.
Please restrict the name to 100 characters or less.

param.name: bigwig_files
param.label: Bigwig files:
param.help: Select the files to include in the new VEuPathDB My Data Set. The bigwig files you select here must be mapped to the reference genome that you select below.

param.name: overrideDbkey
param.label: Reference genome:
param.help: The bigwig files you selected above must be mapped to the reference genome that you select here.

tool.help:
.. class:: infomark
**What it does** (check this Tutorial_!)
This tool exports one or more bigwig files to a VEuPathDB site creating a new My Data Set to contain them. Typically the bigwig files in your My Data Set should belong to one Study. The reference genome you specify determines which VEuPathDB site the new My Data Set will be exported to. For example, if you choose P.falciparum 3D7 the export will be sent to PlasmoDB.org_.
More accurately, your new My Data Set will be available on any VEuPathDB site for you to share or download, but only in PlasmoDB you will be able to open the bigwig files as Genome Browser tracks, against any other publicly available PlasmoDB tracks.
.. _PlasmoDB.org: http://plasmodb.org .. _Tutorial: http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=igQZHjRBqV0
